website_summaries.verdict: Quality mat sits at a low price point and gets the job done well.
pros: Mat heats up quickly and evenly
Most seeds sprout within 3 to 7 days
The subtle heat helps move along the growth process without drying out your soil
Power connection is securely covered to protect from potential water spills
cons: Mat arrives rolled up and takes quite some time to flatten out

customer_reviews.title: Potential fire hazard
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this heat mat in my beetle colony for a couple weeks and today I found their cage full of smoke. The heat mat had nearly caught on fire and was melted and smoldering. I read the safety instructions and thought this would be a safer than a heat lamp but now I'm not so sure. I believe the problem was that the mat had rolled up partially and the parts that were touching melted the plastic cover, maybe if it is kept totally flat it would be safe. I used this in combination with a thermostat controller but also had issues with it getting hot enough, it seemed barely warm the other times I had checked it.
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: Seeds warm and Toasty
customer_reviews.text: These are keeping seeds warm and toasty in their flats in the greenhouse at night. Great not to have to worry about them not germinating. Update: seedlings germinated in less than half the usual time@
customer_reviews.author: TrykaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - increased seed germination
customer_reviews.text: Pretty straightforward to use and is the same size as a tray for seeds. I have been starting seeds indoors a couple years now, and usually have 2-4 pots where no seeds germinate, and 3-4 stragglers that take much longer than the rest of the tray to show anything. I set this up about 10 days ago and only have 1 out of 18 pots looking like either a straggler or failure. Some of the seeds started in less than 3 days!
customer_reviews.author: MsChris

customer_reviews.title: GREAT HEATING PAD
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my baby Sulcata Tortoise during the winter, which she has to spend indoors. She loves it! Sprawls out on it all the time. Turned my other Tortoise friends on to it too. They were using heat lamps. The heat lamps were hiking up their electric bills, this pad does not.
customer_reviews.author: COLLEEN

customer_reviews.title: Nice durable seed mat. Takes a little while to flatten.
customer_reviews.text: Using this to heat a small space used to keep a homebrew beer carboy warm in the basement. Not quite what it was intended for, but it works well and uses very little electricity. It comes in a tube-type box and is rolled up. You have to lay it flat and put something heavy on it then turn it on and it will flatten out. Not the best packaging design, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Michael MTop Contributor: Brewing

customer_reviews.title: runs hot!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to germinate pepper seeds, in my flat its a constant 76F and the container on the mat would go close to 100F+, it fried most of my seeds that I had in the container, so what I did was I put a piece of rockwool under each corner of the container between the container and the mat so theres an air gap between the mat and the container, and now the temp inside the container is 80-85F which is perfect. Taking 2 stars off for the thing being a furnace and killing my seeds, I've also read other reviews saying its not hot enough which means bad quality control, so another star off for that.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Burton

customer_reviews.title: Where to start??
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Crinkled up wrinkled up cheaply made piece of pure junk. Description says it has a thermostat which to me implies that the temp is user settable. Not even. Won't lay flat no matter what I try. Read ALL of the 1 star reviews before you even think about buying this. I rarely leave 1 star reviews but this product really has it coming. Mine's going back needless to say.
customer_reviews.author: PJClark

customer_reviews.title: Runs too Hot and uses too much energy costs!
customer_reviews.text: Runs a little hot! Takes a ton of electricity to run too. It's costing me over $20 a month to use.
customer_reviews.author: WendySue

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: Now that I've got it set up, it is working perfectly! I have 4 seeding trays (1020) on it and it is working very well. Ordering another soon!!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Be sure keep in mind that because this heating mat is a little small, not the usual size that will heat a full 32 cell seed tray, measure your flat if you choose to buy, which I would not recommend. The mat does not come with a protective cover (like a "pillowcase"), so when in use will create a hot plastic surface up against the bottom the more fragile plastic surface of the seed tray. Not a good practice. Also, there is no temperature control on the mat. One heat bakes all.
customer_reviews.author: katherine

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem to evenly heat. 1/2 the mat is much warmer than other 1/2
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Good subtle heat bump to increase odds of rootings for cuttings!
customer_reviews.text: This mat is a good one! No thermostat needed as it's self regulating at a warm but not hot temperature that has helped keep the temperature of the soil and even jars of water I'm using for rooting cuttings in water. At stable and warmer temps, it has been very helpful in cool SF climate indoors. The mat is not so warm that it dries out the soil, but just enough to encourage rooting in soil and water- my prime interest in having the mat: getting cuttings to root!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: heats up fast to 85* which would cook my clones so make sure to order a controller
customer_reviews.author: jdub

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed heat mat...
customer_reviews.text: These are the crappiest heat mats I have ever seen. They are constructed with loosly fitting components. The cord comes out on the side rather than the end and prevents you from placing multiple trays closely, which is nice when placing your trays under a light. The mats do not lay flat and have several wrinkles interfering with the contact of the mat and tray. I opend the box and immediately returned all three which I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: ChuckleHead

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and worked well
customer_reviews.text: If you are just starting out germinating your own seeds or dont have a large garden, this seedling heat mat is perfect. It's inexpensive and has even heat that is just right for most seeds. The only drawback is that there is no heat control, but I still had great success using it and had all but 1 of my seeds germinate. I recommend this mat if you're just starting out germinating seeds or have a small garden and don't want to make a large investment in a seedling mat you only use a couple of times a year.
customer_reviews.author: LTW

customer_reviews.title: Super hot
customer_reviews.text: Mine Gets super hot so ive been putting a towel or rack in between but i cant get the right temp for germination. Im not so happy. And because it gets so hot, im afraid to leave it alone
customer_reviews.author: J A - San Jose, CA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hastening germination.
customer_reviews.text: Having spent a fortune over the years on annuals for my baskets and containers I decided to grow my own flowers this year. I’m very much a novice but research led me to this heat mat. It’s definately made a difference to my lobelia. The ones that didn’t fit on the mat haven’t germinated as quickly. I’ll be buying more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Siobhan E

customer_reviews.title: SPECTACULAR! THIS REALLY WORKS
customer_reviews.text: This thing really works! I planted coleus seeds, which normally take 10-12 weeks to germinate on its own. In 3 days under the heating pad, there's already germination! I couldn't believe it, and it's growing quickly too! This is a great tool to create an ideal environment for a healthy start for your seeds. This pays for itself in the money saved from buying full grown plants and transplanting. I'm going to order a few more of these
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Too hot for kombucha warmer
customer_reviews.text: The mat works great and I have no complaints as to the workmanship or anything. I docked a star because it actually worked a little too well - kept all my stuff at about 95F which was too warm. I tried some water kefir, kombucha, and chia sprouts, and it was too much for all of them. I'll have to figure out how to tone it down.
customer_reviews.author: Larissa

customer_reviews.title: worked for maybe 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mat with hopes of it helping me start some of my heat loving tropical seeds, however, it worked for a few minutes after i plugged it in and hasn't worked since. I should've listened to the reviews that said this happened and saved my money!
customer_reviews.author: Organic life

customer_reviews.title: First use had great results 100% germination
customer_reviews.text: I can't complain. Our hydroponic tent is in the basement and while it is warm it isn't toasty. Used this mat to germinate a couple of tomato and basil plants and they germinated straight away. I know it generated heat as before the mat the seed tray would take 2-3 weeks to use up the water. With the mat the water was gone in a week. So watch your water levels in the seed tray.
customer_reviews.author: Alex P.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Still working
customer_reviews.text: The mat has stayed on constantly since i bought this mat. Temp is warm to the touch and consistent. You cannot control the temperature but I don't mind that. I actually got a store bought lemon , used the seed and it has sprouted and that's a first. I'm trying bird of paradise now. This mat is big enough for a starter tray or a few pots and that's all I need. It has a plastic feel to the mat so it is waterproof I guess and easy to wipe and clean. Good item and would buy again
customer_reviews.author: midnightfox

customer_reviews.title: Wanna expedite germination--buy this pad.
customer_reviews.text: This heating pad is perfect! I am so glad I found it. I had some peppers that after almost 2 weeks were not germinating. Finally decided to get the heating pad and we have take off! Even heating. This is a great investment. I am someone who just does not want to spend a lot on gardening supplies. There are so many ways to make the process work without spending, but this heating pad was without a doubt a worthwhile investment. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Eureka

customer_reviews.title: Gardeners... Just get one
customer_reviews.text: I got this especially to start pepper seedlings which normally take around two weeks to germinate. With this mat I had seedlings popping up within a week. I also had my other veggies on the flat it was under and they sprouted in record time. I left it under until everything was an inch or so high. Definitely helped me get my most successful round of starts ever. I've only used it one season, but it shows no wear. Would definitely recommend to anyone who gardens. You could easily save the money you spend on this by starting your own plants from seed.
customer_reviews.author: bsting

customer_reviews.title: Seedling Heat Mat - all purpose
customer_reviews.text: This mat is great to start seeds with. It is waterproof and made out of strong material. It is thicker than most I have used. I use one for seeds/small plants but have another mat I use for my herbal products that need warmth to make. I can also set my tea pot on it in the winter to keep the tea warm throughout the day. So I can use it for more than one purpose. Great pad for the price. I will be getting more of them as needed.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Great for rooting plants
customer_reviews.text: Plug this in & within a few minutes you have a balanced level of heat that's perfect for seedlings or in my case rooting houseplants. I have used this now for a couple of months & absolutely love it. It speeds up the process of rooting plants without getting to warm and creating a possible issue. The material is well made and stands up to constant use & the occasional spill of water drops & easily wipes off. If you are propagating this is a tool you NEED!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The temprtuer didnt reach like what they said waste of money
customer_reviews.author: HANOONA NOONA

customer_reviews.title: Do not use without a heat mat thermostat
customer_reviews.text: Extremely hot, many seedlings were fried. Needed to buy a heat mat thermostat for this product to be useable, which was expensive. The heat mat thermostat indicated that this mat was keeping 4 inch pots at 86 degrees F. in a 60 degree F. room. Do yourself a favor and buy a Vivosun heat mat which doesn't overheat and you will not need to buy a separate thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Floranflorida

customer_reviews.title: Nicely designed, cheaper than the expensive heating systems out ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to brew kombucha when my house was dropping below 70 and didn't want to turn the heat on. This brought the temperature up to ~78-80. It sped up the brewing time and really worked well. Nicely designed, cheaper than the expensive heating systems out there for kombucha. I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Buy one that has a temperature control!
customer_reviews.text: I foolishly assumed that an unregulated "seedling" heat mat would not heat to a temperature high enough to kill the seeds by roasting them alive. Lost 3 out of 6 seedlings after using the mat for 2 days and then realizing that it was heating to 95 degrees after checking it with a thermometer. Removing the mat saved half the seedling but their growth was stunted by the trauma. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Do you not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Please do not waste your money on the ceiling mat. The lowest temperature I was able to record was at 87° despite what it claims on the packaging and there is no way to adjust it in anyway. I feel like it was a very very big waste of money and very very disappointed. There is one much cheaper at a better website with the control to adjust that you could find online quite easily.
customer_reviews.author: Josh S.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't heat at all.
customer_reviews.text: Judging by the other reviews I must have been one of the unlucky ones that got a dead unit. Mine doesn't get hot at all. Unfortunately I let it sit in the closet unused while my Amazon return period expired.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno Bronosky

customer_reviews.title: Very stiff and low quality
customer_reviews.text: First off, it smelled very very strongly of plastic. And the material was very inflexible. I turned it on, and the smell of plastic got even stronger. No way I would feel safe using this. I was planning on leaving it under my seedlings to keep them warm through the night. Unfortunately, I had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Races

customer_reviews.title: It works and is great price
customer_reviews.text: Wish these things had a built in temp control, almost like a dimmer switch. Without a controller, you have to pay attention to make sure you aren't under or over temp, usually requires putting towels between the product and the plant tray. I just wish there was an easier way to dial it in without a controller
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Follow the directions...
customer_reviews.text: I almost returned this because I thought it wasn’t working - and then I read the directions. That always helps! It’s working perfectly now, keeping seed starters nice & warm. It stays at the temperature I set. Entire mat is warm, no hot or cold spots, lies flat, no odor.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieD

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after being plugged in for two days.
customer_reviews.text: Seller was great...It's the product. Rec'd, opened, plugged in, tossed box it came in, worked for two days and doesn't heat anymore. I have unplugged it and plugged back in several times thinking it would jolt it into working but no such luck. I would return for my money back however I do not have the box it came in. (not the amazon box but the actual item box) Not happy with this purchased!
customer_reviews.author: Logan Null

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This mat worked great for sprouting all my seeds that needed a bit of extra heat. It doesn't get too hot, so I never worry about the seeds being "cooked", despite the lack of a thermostat. It's a huge help for sprouting chilies, sage, squash, cucumbers, and more!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great success
customer_reviews.text: The product has performed flawlessly. After weeks of successfully germinating seeds we bought a second one to double our plant production. Before using either one we plugged it in to warm the out cover to allow it to flatten out. Te temperature range is 70-85 degrees so it may not seem warm to the touch unless you're in a cold room. The heat is evident when moisture appear on the lid of the container indicating condensation because the lid is cooler than the base. Have recommended these to my garden group and would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Corradino

customer_reviews.title: High germination rate
customer_reviews.text: I used this mat to germinate seeds before planting. I kept a digital thermometer probe amongst the seed baggies, and adjusted temperature by adding towel layers above and below as needed. I had near 100 percent germination for everything except peppers. No thinning required, no wasted seeds, and the seedlings are being hardened off for planting in the ground much earlier than usual. Will use this again for future seed starting.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a windowsill seed starter or cuttings. The warmth is gentle, just enough to get things started, and with a sealed container will not dry the soil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seedlings love it.
customer_reviews.text: It does have hot spots, which I wish would even out, but it always flattens out to do its job and it folds away nicely when finished.
customer_reviews.author: Noxilicious

customer_reviews.title: Nice Item
customer_reviews.text: It is what was described. I don't care for the cord they used - thick like I would see for an appliance - a little bulky on my cabinet. The wattage is so low it wasn't necessary to use that type of cord. I have another one of these from another seller and it doesn't have this type of cord.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So I have had this for 10 months use only like 3 weeks not that's it's getting cold. Well is stoped working. Only like 3" in the middle would heat up. I then um plugged it and found that it was melted in the middle. I cut the mat open then I saw the issue sloppy manufacturing. 4 of the heating cable are all over lapping each other.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I didn't know I needed a thermostat
customer_reviews.text: The first one stopped working. I think it's because I didn't know I needed a temperature controller for it? I wouldn't think it could just burn itself out though. They sent a replacement for it though and I got a thermostat, it works perfectly now!
customer_reviews.author: Stomkat

customer_reviews.title: A disappoint
customer_reviews.text: I love this and would have given more stars all 5 but it seemed only one side worked! On the side that did my seedlings sprouted beautifully! Unfortunately my strawberries and tomatoe seedlings were on the side that didnt seem to work and I got one or two leaves to sprout.
customer_reviews.author: Shavya McIntyer

customer_reviews.title: Barely warm to the touch
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I'm not sure if I got a defective heat mat, but it is barely warm to the touch. According to some of these reviews, which is what I based my purchase of off, stated that it was hotter than what is currently being produced. I have purchased a thermostat controller and it only goes up to 67 degrees. I have sent an email to the company and still have not heard back. I am highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Alexiss

customer_reviews.title: Doubles as a foot warmer
customer_reviews.text: I live in a trailer with wood flooring and my feet are always so cold sitting at the computer desk. I had purchased this for a project for this spring but realized I could use it to keep my little piggies from freezing on the hardwood.. Works great so far!
customer_reviews.author: J L

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! Im using under my kombucha brewing jugs ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! Im using under my kombucha brewing jugs during the night when I turn my furnace down to 68. Its working great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Germination station.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heat mat to help grow Joshua trees from seeds. All the info says they're difficult to grow and take forever to germinate. This picture is after only 3 days on wet paper towels in a tupperware on the heat mat.
customer_reviews.author: Dusti

customer_reviews.title: How long will it stay warm?
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these heating mats for about a month and have begun to notice they may not be staying as warm as when they were new. Before I buy more of any mats I will try to determine how long they will stay warm. I leave mine on continuously.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical, but I saw a friend had one. After a windstorm destroyed my outside green house.. I had to start all over. I planted my seeds in a tray with a lid, and within 6 days 80% of my seeds have sprouted! I’m amazed! Awesome buy to start from inside growing!!
customer_reviews.author: Desire Ahearn

customer_reviews.title: Good, but a bit pricy
customer_reviews.text: Does that it's intended to do. No temp control, so not a lot of options other than put things in between to modulate temperature. Good product, but I'd like to see a product like this in the more reasonable $8-10 range
customer_reviews.author: Laura Santini

customer_reviews.title: Not good for mushrooms
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to control temperature of mushroom cultures while they incubate. This did only marginal to keep them up to 70 in a 55 degree room. In fact most times it was only ten degrees warmer than the room. I even put my cultures in a tote and had the tote closed.
customer_reviews.author: Joe G

customer_reviews.title: nice heat mat
customer_reviews.text: these mats are perfect for small tray heating they have a pre set temp so pretty much plug in and go, and they work very well in the seed starting process. Add a dome on the tray and you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Really seemed to help my seedlings
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work really well. This was my first time starting seeds and didn’t expect much success. To my surprise, all of my seedlings did great! I did notice that they started growing a lot faster once I put this mat underneath them. Could have been a coincidence but I think the mat did help. I have reccomended it to friends who wish to start seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie White

customer_reviews.title: Great for resin
customer_reviews.text: My house is kept pretty cool for comfort and I've had issues getting my resin to cure properly, so I bought this to work on and it made a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: S. OConnor

customer_reviews.title: Great heating mat - very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This is my first hearing mat and I’m really happy with it. My cucumber and pepper seeds would not germinate (i guess it wasn’t hot enough) but after I put them on the mat, I woke up the next day with fresh, healthy sprouts! This product really delivered and I would recommend it to anyone who is trying to get a good start on their seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Total Junk
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. It's rolled up so tight I needed 2 days to flatten it with boxes. Then only half of one side got warm and not hot. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: smartypants

customer_reviews.title: Works well with a thermostat.
customer_reviews.text: Don't use without a thermostat. I lost a whole batch of expensive fig cuttings because I used this mat without a thermostat. My peat bin got up to 120 degrees!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: Works great for starting seeds!
customer_reviews.text: Working so well for the seeds am starting for spring. Purple coneflower! It’s been 5 days or so - wish I’d marked the date- and they are beginning to sprout. It does for a lot of condensation so have to set the top at an angle. It’s great and also a great price. May order another!
customer_reviews.author: Therese

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Believe it or not this is great for proofing my bread
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Sabol

customer_reviews.title: It works fine, but doesn't sit as flat or unroll as smoothly as other mats at this price
customer_reviews.text: Not bad! but other brands come unrolled smooth and wrinkle free, and this mat does not ever sit perfectly flat/it has some wrinkles. it doesnt affect function, but there are other mats that are about a dollar more that are worth the delta in price
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Used under my reptile tank
customer_reviews.text: I used this under by bearded dragon tank to keep him warm at night. It gets the job done efficiently. To get this item completely flat, you will need to lay something under it with weight ontop. No temperature control but does not run hot.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Gallo

customer_reviews.title: Not so great...
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes it's warm, sometimes it's not. I have better luck starting my seeds by putting them on top of my TV cable box, it's warmer and has more uniform heat.
customer_reviews.author: Hank&Dorothy

customer_reviews.title: Hot spots
customer_reviews.text: Easy to plug in and use but very sporadic where it’s actually warm. Has hot spots. Would not buy again n don’t recommend performance wise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: gets too hot
customer_reviews.text: it raised the temp of my starter tray to 104 degrees F killed my peppers and tomatoes I am not happy or impressed by this product
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Ronnenberg

customer_reviews.title: Now I have warm cacti and succulent babies!!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for what I bought it for. My succulent and cacti collection got this to keep them warm and prevent any frost or too low temperatures. I must say they have been absolutely loving it! Excellent product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Works for fermenting
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my fermenter. I have a stainless half barrel conical and usually brew 10 gallon batches. I can't get temps above about 75 degrees, but it works pretty good otherwise. I might try a second pad and see if that works. Unlike heating pads, this does shut off after a period of time. Bouns.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Holden

customer_reviews.title: Great multi use item
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical with this. But after starting the seedlings that did very well, way better than without the heater. Could even put under a chick pen to keep them warm.
customer_reviews.author: BrassKnuckles

customer_reviews.title: plant growth
customer_reviews.text: the heat mat arrived on time and started using it the next day. has increased my seed germination time on the seeds. works great. thinking about ordering another one.
customer_reviews.author: donald a.

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: States not to get wet or operate when you are not at home... I don’t want a fire if I am home either. Plants and seeds need water so...
customer_reviews.author: C89

customer_reviews.title: Only works in the center
customer_reviews.text: It's not worth my effort to return, but my unit only warms in the middle 3 inches. Edges are completely cool. I'd look elsewhere. Not pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Kellbell

customer_reviews.title: Will buy more
customer_reviews.text: Bought it, used it, got pepper seedlings in a week, solid purchase.pepper seedling usually take 3-4 weeks to sprout in PA in February but this mat accelerated it. Sol happy I bought a second one
customer_reviews.author: DaddyCJ

customer_reviews.title: It’s decent
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t get near as warm as I was given the impression of. Found myself still using a small heat lamp to supplement. It would be good for those who need very little heat. I do run it almost constantly and have had no issues whatsoever doing so. No shorts or anything like that.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Garris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This gets and stays warm quickly and controls it's own temperature. Great if you're ok with a range and don't need exact. Says it works wirh a timer if you buy one but I have not.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Danger

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: Not very good. Once you use this and try to roll it back it will not maintain its shape curls on the sides. Not very warm, even with a light thus would not held germination.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: a great  value!!!
customer_reviews.text: this mat is great so far my peas are all hatching !!!!! and also it is very comparable to the 25.00 mat for less than half the price!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: goldnuggetgal

customer_reviews.title: Works just as described!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and works just as described. The pad warms up fast and will hopefully make my new plants/seedlings come alive soon! Shipping was fast and well packaged. Left it on overnight and no issues. Definitely recommend to anyone trying to prepare seedlings in the garage or some place with not a ton of sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Konrady

customer_reviews.title: It didnt last.
customer_reviews.text: We use this pad as a warmer under our small animal cage. It's perfect for that since it doesn't get too hot or time out... however, we used this for 2 months and then it died. I was kind of hoping it would last longer than that.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Burns clones
customer_reviews.text: Got way to hot! Never had a heat mat get this hot! Burns hand to the touch. Ruined half my clones and the were only on the heat pad a day and a half! Turned the stem to mush. Been cloning a long time never had this happen! Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't produce enough heat to keep fiber pots warm.
customer_reviews.text: While these do work somewhat, they take a long time to heat up and do not get warm enough. I would not buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Elzy

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping warmth on my Kombucha
customer_reviews.text: I loved the first mat so much that I bought another one. I have used this to keep my Kombucha warm on chillier days. Also, I have used one of them to help keep warm my second fermenting bottles. I would definitely buy another if needed!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon M Smith

customer_reviews.title: I use these to heat my solar battery bank
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't draw much power & several are ample to keep a well insulated battery bank toasty.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy and perfect for indoor garden
customer_reviews.text: Heat mat is automatically set at a great temp for germinating seeds and perfect for seed growth !
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Nice Isaiah

customer_reviews.title: gets my seeds off to a quick start
customer_reviews.text: A little heat under your seedlings gets them sprouting faster. This mat (which I have 2 of) is a nice just right temp to keep my soil warm for quick seed starts
customer_reviews.author: PattyHob

customer_reviews.title: Effortless Germinating
customer_reviews.text: works great and keeps a steady temperature. Plug in and let it do it's thing. Super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Alan Wooldridge

customer_reviews.title: Better than perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely pleased with this one! Cheap, well built, tough material easy to clean and resistant. Temperature wise is impressively stable and spot on. Perfect size for 1gallon jar where I brew my komboocha.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus P. Chaves

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work fine for me. I was growing Carolina reapers and they popped up temperature held.Not too hot or anything I was very leery of buying this because all the bad reviews but it worked out for me.
customer_reviews.author: ike

customer_reviews.title: Product is a good price for the size in comparison to the Vivosun
customer_reviews.text: Product is a good price for the size in comparison to the Vivosun, which I have several of. It does what it’s suppose to. Not pleased with the fact that it’s not ever gonna be entirely flat. This products top insulation layer is longer then it should be which causes bubbles/ripples so it won’t rver be flat.
customer_reviews.author: John A.

customer_reviews.title: seeds germinated X% faster!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a mather, so i don't know how much faster, but they did sprout really quick. in three days tomatoes and cucumber were up. in 5 days a dozen or so onions and within two weeks jalapenos. i've had it in the cold dark garage, under a 45W LED grow light (even tho the instructions say not to use both, i'm a rebel)
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This product is disappointing. I wanted something to keep my pepper seeds hot for germination. This mat barely remains 70 degrees and the whole mat isn’t hot, only the lines where the wires are for heat. It’s well made but not hot for any real usage.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Giggans

customer_reviews.title: Buy it if you want it
customer_reviews.text: Honestly best one I’ve used. Even though it’s cheap $ wise it’s still high quality material and the cord isn’t all flimsy either. Ordered another one too
customer_reviews.author: Shopp 4 Fun1

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer will not respond to numerous attempts to contact
customer_reviews.text: Mat overheated to the point it melted the plastic seed beds to the mat. Mat cracked open exposing the heating wires within. Company will not respond to emails sent. Mat lasted about a month before becoming totally worthless. I do not recommend this product or manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: David Prewitt

customer_reviews.title: Works well...good price
customer_reviews.text: From other reviews, I was expecting hot spots, but am not seeing any evidence of that. I raised the seed tray up on 3/8th dowels to allow air flow. Tomatoes germinated in three days. Will purchase additional mats!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Messick

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: This is great but there is not a way to change the temperature. I’m happy with it though.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: Good item for $
customer_reviews.text: Does the job- I use it for African violet leaves to start new plants and it’s consistent and warm without being too hot.
customer_reviews.author: treehugger

customer_reviews.title: Great for dough to rise!
customer_reviews.text: I use the mat to help dough rise. It keeps it at a perfect temperature.
customer_reviews.author: MommyShopper

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to hold temp well. Clones are not burning. Staying about 80°f under the little makeshift tent we have them under.
customer_reviews.author: Shane R.

customer_reviews.title: Safe to use.
customer_reviews.text: Gentle heat. I think it made a difference with my peat pots. I have them on a window sill with a towel between the sill and the cookie sheet I put the peat pots on. Never got dangerously hot at all but the set up seemed warm enough to help.
customer_reviews.author: jnadrig

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I've had a garden for several years and di not use a heat mat for germination. This year I bought this one and I'm glad I did because on day 5 I have tomato's popping. Good investment~
customer_reviews.author: Tom

product_meta.title: MET certified Seedling Heat Mat, Seedfactor Waterproof Durable Germination Station Heat Mat, Warm Hydroponic Heating Pad for Indoor Home Gardening Seed Starter(10" x 20")
product_meta.description:
Size:1 Pack-10" X 20"Nurture your seedlings by ensuring they have a warm area for root growth and germination. 
This Seeding Heat Mat speeds up the transplanting process by keeping the soil between 70℉and 85℉. 
Intended for indoor use only, this product is waterproof and easy to clean to make storage a breeze. 
Available in small medium and large sizes and carries an MET safety certification.
The Seedfactor Seeding Heat Mat adopts the latest 7.5MM thickening,105 degrees of high temperature resistant cylindrical SJTW water-proof power cord (thicker than the general power cord, solid, high temperature resistant), safer and more durable, and guarantee the stability of seedling mat safety work.
feature_bullets: MET safety certified；Comply with UL 499；CSA C22.2 No.64
Ensures the root area of seedlings remains between 70℉and 85℉ to ensure growth and increased germination
Available in 4 sizes: Mini：3.5"x21", Watt: 7.3W ; Small: 10"x20", Watt: 17.5W ; Medium: 20"x20", Watt: 45W ; Large: 48"x20", Watt: 100W

Designing with waterproof construction, our seeding heat mat is safe for use indoor plantings,The new, stronger heating wire and thicker multi-layer construction offer more uniform heating and the durability to withstand rugged greenhouse environments.

The Seedfactor Seeding Heat Mat adopts the latest 7.5MM thickening,105 degrees of high temperature resistant cylindrical SJTW 5.9ft water-proof power cord (thicker than the general power cord, solid, high temperature resistant), safer and more durable, and guarantee the stability of seedling mat safety work.
